files.description: Entry-point script that runs a research cycle and enforces the policy that at least one file in the outputs directory is added or updated each cycle, with a portable fallback when outputs is unwritable.
Core library module that detects the writable outputs directory, snapshots outputs state, validates per-cycle changes, and provides helpers to create/update required minimum v1 output documents.
Minimum v1 outputs index that explains the outputs policy, lists core documents, and describes how each research cycle updates at least one outputs file.
Core documentation file capturing the current consolidated findings/decisions and serving as a required per-cycle update target for the outputs policy.
Configuration defining the outputs directory preference order, minimum v1 required files, and the per-cycle enforcement rules used by the pipeline script.
Support document describing the on-disk snapshot format used to compare outputs across cycles and how the enforcement logic determines added/updated files.

missionDescription: Implement the 'minimum v1' output set in /outputs/ (at least README.md plus one additional core doc), then enforce a rule: every research cycle adds/updates at least one /outputs file.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker

Curated insight (actionability 8-9/10): Provides a concrete, minimal v1 artifact set to bootstrap the system from zero files to a functioning research pipeline, establishing persistence, traceability, and a place to store surveyed sources, ...
